name: Ambient Sound Composer
description:
This tool functions as a personal soundscape generator, creating single ambient audio experiences tailored to your specific prompts. By leveraging a Large Language Model (LLM), it intelligently selects and mixes sounds from a library to produce a unique MP3 file that matches the mood or environment you describe.

(Note: To build longer evolving sound journeys, use the tool 'ambient sound journey composer', which uses the present tool under the hood.)

### How to Use the Tool:

This tool offers a straightforward, step-by-step process for creating your ideal ambient soundscape:

1.  **Download the Sound Library**: Before you can generate any soundscapes, you must first download the necessary audio assets. To do this, simply run the tool with the `download_assets` option set to `True`. This will fetch the default sound library from a GitHub repository and store it on your local machine. The tool supports .mp3 and .wav sound files.

2.  **Customize with Your Own Sounds (Optional)**: You have the creative freedom to expand the sound library. To add your own audio, just place any MP3 or WAV files into the designated `assets_folder`. You can also create subfolders to organize your sounds by category. For best results, use only a 2 level depth (categories, subcategories, no more). The tool will automatically detect and integrate these new files, making them available for your soundscapes.

3.  **Generate Your Soundscape**: Once your sound library is ready, you can start creating. Provide a descriptive `prompt` detailing the type of ambient sound you want (e.g., "a peaceful forest with a gentle stream and distant birds"). The tool will then generate a custom MP3 file based on your description.

4.  **Explore Your Sound Options (Optional)**: If you're unsure what sounds are available or want to get ideas for your prompts, you can set the `show_available_sounds` option to `True`. This will provide a complete list of all the sounds in your library, including any you've added yourself, without generating an audio file.
author: @@official.shinkai

assets_folder.description: Relative folder under the user's home where sound assets are stored (e.g., I:\User\Musique\ambient_sounds).

force_download.description: Whether to force re-download assets from an online source even if they exist locally. Default : false.

github_repo_api_url.description: GitHub API URL to discover sound assets (repository contents endpoint). Default : https://api.github.com/repos/remvze/moodist/contents/public/sounds.

llm_max_retries.description: Maximum number of retries for the LLM to produce a valid composition. Default : 2.

llm_provider.description: Optional LLM to use for composition generation (overrides the LLM selected in the chat). Use LLM IDs as displayed in Shinkai (e.g., 'shinkai_free_trial', 'gpt_5_mini').

prompt.description: Text prompt describing the desired mood and elements for the soundscape. Be as detailed as possible. Use elements matching your available sound assets.

download_assets.description: If true, discover and download sound assets from the configured GitHub repository to the assets folder

show_available_sounds.description: If true, return a categorized listing of available local sounds instead of generating a mix

max_sounds.description: Maximum number of sounds the LLM should select for the mix.  Default : 5.

duration_minutes.description: Desired length of the generated soundscape in minutes.  Default : 20.

available_sounds.description: Categorized listing of available sounds when show_available_sounds is true
available_sounds.name: available_sounds

composition.description: The composition metadata including selected sounds, notes, prompt and timestamps
composition.name: composition

createdAt.description: ISO timestamp when composition was created

notes.description: Notes provided by the LLM about the selection

sounds.description: List of selected sounds with metadata

composition_path.description: Filesystem path to the saved composition JSON
composition_path.name: composition_path

downloaded_files.description: List of file paths that were downloaded from GitHub during the run
downloaded_files.name: downloaded_files

generated_mp3_path.description: Filesystem path to the generated MP3 file
generated_mp3_path.name: generated_mp3_path
